agency_desc: A public nonprofit organization that provides hairpieces to financially disadvantaged children under age 21 suffering from long-term medical hair loss from any diagnosis.
service_description: Provides custom-made, natural hairpieces to financially disadvantaged young people, under age 21, who are suffering from hair loss for any medical reason. Synthetic hairpieces may be provided to children under age six and to those suffering from shorter-term medical hair loss.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- Automated Information Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Living in the United States, Puerto Rico, or Canada -- Age 21 or younger -- With long-term hair loss due to any medical condition (shorter-term medical hair loss may be considered for synthetic wigs) -- Low-income/financially disadvantaged

agency_desc: A public nonprofit organization that provides hairpieces to financially disadvantaged children under age 21 suffering from long-term medical hair loss from any diagnosis.
service_description: Accepts donations of human hair, which is used to manufacture hair pieces for financially disadvantaged young people (under age 21) who are suffering from long-term hair loss for any medical reason.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- Automated Information Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open; minimum 10 inches of hair (unbleached); call the information line or visit the website for a complete list of guidelines.

agency_desc: A private agency that offers primarily web-listings of Section 8 rental properties across the nation.
service_description: Provides information primarily about Section 8 rental options nationwide and works with local housing authorities to maintain recent listings. Website visitors may search for housing by area, price, property types, and more. Printed listings are not provided by mail or fax.
site_details: Visit the website, type in the zip code to find Section 8 rental properties, and click "Search Rentals." Select "Print Listings" to obtain a printed copy of the search.
